page.title: 13ROXHOLM ESTATE,LEASINGHAM.
page.content: Mr Robertson owns farmland in the parishes of{Ruskington,Leasingham, {Cranwell,North Rauceby}and{Roxholm. The land around here is made up of heavy clay,light sand in gravel,lime- stone and heathstone brash.Rainfall averages 25 inches per annum. A variety of crops is grown:1500acres are devoted to winter wheat,winter barley,spring barley,sugar beet, potatoes and peas, whilst a further 1200 acres are taken up by grassland for grazing and conservation(sileage), sub-letting and woods,roads and buildings. {Dairy cows:}There are 3 herds of cattle,each consisting of 200 cows, mainly Friesians. {Highland cattle:}A small herd,perhaps unique in the area,originally sired by "Alastair of Brockstones".
